H5281.def: = woman, who at some time called herself {L:Mara<SDBH:מָרָא>}; ► wife of {L:Elimelech<SDBH:אֱלִימֶלֶךְ>}, mother of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>} and {L:Chilion<SDBH:כִּלְיֹון>}, and mother-in-law of {L:Ruth<SDBH:רוּת>} and {L:Orpah<SDBH:עָרְפָּה>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H4494.def: literally: rest; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H4130.def: = a person connected by blood or by marriage

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H1637.def: = level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H5480.def: = action by which humans pour or rub liquid, usually olive oil, on their body ► to clean and smooth the skin as an act of grooming

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8071.def: = a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose-fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7327.def: = woman; ◄ from {L:Moab<SDBH:מֹואָב>}; ► wife of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>}, son of {L:Elimelech<SDBH:אֱלִימֶלֶךְ>}, after the death of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>} she married {L:Boaz<SDBH:בֹּעַז>} and so became the mother of {L:Obed<SDBH:עֹובֵד>} and the great-grandmother of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}
